awd_titl_txt: Chemical Branching in Photodissociation: Theoretical Studies
awd_abstract_narration: This grant from the Theoretical and Computational Chemistry                     Program supports studies of the factors that determine relative                 amounts of various chemical fragments that are produced when a                  molecule decomposes after absorption of light energy.  This                     will contibute to the development of schemes to control product                 formation in chemical reactions via design of coherent pulse                    sequences.                                                                                                                                                      The project will involve the development of new theoretical                     methods for calculation of wave packet propagation on                           bifurcating potential energy surfaces, a new and promising                      method for the treatment of chemical dynamics.  Applications                    will be made to several systems of current experimental                         interest, including ozone, methyl iodide, methylene iodide, and                 bromoiodomethane.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
